Correlations between infectious diseases and gender inequality.

facebook.title: How a decline in infectious diseases may have boosted gender equality
facebook.summary: Reductions in the prevalence of infectious disease are associated with increases in gender equality in the United States and the United Kingdom over the past several decades, reports a study published in the new journal Nature Human Behaviour. Read the pap

facebook.title: How a decline in infectious diseases may have boosted gender equality
facebook.summary: The rise in gender equality coincided with the decline in infectious diseases in Western countries. This was not a coincidence.

news.title: Infectious diseases and gender equality are unrelated, right? Wrong, says research
news.summary: With the recent election of Donald Trump as president-elect of the US it may not seem like it, but gender equality has steadily increased in the country over the last few decades.
